abstract.p: New York Knickerbockers are reportedly interested in acquiring forward Danny Fortson from Boston Celtics (S)

block.p: While the Miami Heat works on completing a deal to acquire Brian Grant, the Knicks -- spurned in their efforts to land Grant -- turned their attention once again to Danny Fortson.

A person in the N.B.A. familiar with the situation said the Knicks renewed talks with the Boston Celtics yesterday in an effort to reach a sign-and-trade deal to acquire Fortson, a 6-foot-7-inch power forward. Fortson, who was courted by the Knicks last week in a visit to the team's practice site in Purchase, N.Y., has already turned down the Knicks' offer of the $2.25 million salary cap exception.
While the Miami Heat works on completing a deal to acquire Brian Grant, the Knicks -- spurned in their efforts to land Grant -- turned their attention once again to Danny Fortson.

A person in the N.B.A. familiar with the situation said the Knicks renewed talks with the Boston Celtics yesterday in an effort to reach a sign-and-trade deal to acquire Fortson, a 6-foot-7-inch power forward. Fortson, who was courted by the Knicks last week in a visit to the team's practice site in Purchase, N.Y., has already turned down the Knicks' offer of the $2.25 million salary cap exception.

Because they are over the salary cap, the only other way for the Knicks to obtain Fortson would be in a sign-and-trade, but they are not alone in their efforts to land the burly forward, who is a force on the offensive boards, where the Knicks are sorely in need of help.

While the Knicks and the Golden State Warriors have been the most active teams pursuing Fortson, the deal has been difficult to consummate because he is seeking a contract in the range of $4 million a season.
